  • Constructor Details

    • ParticleBeam

      public ParticleBeam(org.bukkit.Particle.DustOptions options_, int particleAmount, double particleBounds, int particleFrequency)
      Creates a new particle beam, but DOESENT spawn it.
      Parameters:
      options_ - The options (color and size) of the beam.
      particleAmount - The number of pasrticles per "instance"
      particleBounds - What radius around each "instance" to spawn particles
      particleFrequency - The number of times to spawn particles ("instances") per block. More is laggier, but looks better.

  • Method Details

    • setDetectionRange

      public ParticleBeam setDetectionRange(double newRange)
      Changes the detection range of detecting entities the beam "hits". Default is 1 block.
      Parameters:
      newRange - The new range.
      Returns:
      Returns itself.

    • setEndBehavior

      public ParticleBeam setEndBehavior(org.bukkit.scheduler.BukkitRunnable next)
      Creates a new script to run when the beam reaches its target.

    • setEntityBehavior

      public ParticleBeam setEntityBehavior(org.bukkit.scheduler.BukkitRunnable next)
      Creates a new script to run when the hits an entity.

    • setStopAtEntities

      public ParticleBeam setStopAtEntities(boolean next)
      Toggles whether the beam stops when it hits an entity.

    • setParticleSpeed

      public ParticleBeam setParticleSpeed(float next)
      Sets particle "speed" - Probably don't mess with this.

    • setBeamSpeed

      public ParticleBeam setBeamSpeed(int next)
      Sets the amount of ticks it takes for the beam to move 1 block forward. Default is instant.

    • getCurrentEntity

      public org.bukkit.entity.LivingEntity getCurrentEntity()
      Grabs the most recently hit entity, can be used in onEntity bukkitRunnables to grab the entity that was hit.

    • cancel

      public void cancel()
      Cancels a "continous" beam if one exists.

    • createContinuationCast

      public void createContinuationCast(org.bukkit.entity.LivingEntity caster, int maxBlocks, int interval, int endAfter)
      Spawns a beam and continues spawning it.
      Parameters:
      caster - Who to cast the beam from
      maxBlocks - How many blocks can the beam go
      interval - How many ticks to wait between spawning a new beam.
      endAfter - How long before destroying the beam (0 to last until cancelled)

    • getEndCast

      public org.bukkit.Location getEndCast()

    • createTimedFunctional

      public void createTimedFunctional(org.bukkit.entity.LivingEntity caster, int maxBlocks)
      Creates a beam that moves rather than instantly hits its target, and runs onEnd.

    • create

      public void create(org.bukkit.entity.LivingEntity caster, int maxBlocks)
      Create a singular beam from the caster, maxBlocks forward.

    • create

      public void create(org.bukkit.Location start, org.bukkit.Location end)

    • createWeirdContinuation

      public void createWeirdContinuation(org.bukkit.entity.Player caster, int maxBlocks, int interval, int endAfter)
      Failed experiment. Do not use.

    • createWeird

      public void createWeird(org.bukkit.Location tempstart, org.bukkit.Location tempend, org.bukkit.entity.LivingEntity ignore)

    • create

      public void create(org.bukkit.Location start, org.bukkit.Location end, boolean runEntityChecks)
      Creates a beam between two locations
      Parameters:
      runEntityChecks - Whether to check for entities at all during this (less lag, but may interfere with other settings)
